description.narrative: The minister for development cooperation has approved International Media Support (IMS) as partner based on a schematic review of submitted project proposals to the 2021 call for projects for Børnenes U-landskalender (approved 23 march 2021) (ref. approved ‘Indstilling om valg af projekt til Børnenes U-landskalender 2022’)

To increase Tunisian youths’ civic engagement and citizenry, give them a voice of their own, and more broadly contribute to empowering them to drive positive social change and proactive application of their democratic rights, the project will ensure the creation of a network of media run by children and youths (11-17 years old) to serve and inform eight communities in traditionally marginalised areas of the country. IMS will work together with Tunisian non-governmental organisation Al Khatt and its Jaridaty Network (Arabic for “my newspaper”), a youth citizen reporter network created shortly after 2011 that works closely together with state-run youth centres (maisons des jeunes) across the country. The project will establish eight new youth-run community media outlets, train them and equip them with adequate tools and skills to produce verified public interest information targeting their direct communities.
